basics.name: Neezcha Dinman
basics.label: Graduate
basics.summary: Full-stack software engineer with over 4 years of experience in application development, security workflow automation, and IT support. Adept at improving system performance and integrating applications with existing systems. Proficient in JavaScript, Java, and Spring Boot, with a strong foundation in IT infrastructure and end-user support.

highlights: Full stack application development; writing, testing, and peer reviewing.
Front and backend feature requests and improvements on existing applications to schedule and manage workflows for security assessments.
Front end library updates
JavaScript, React, Jest, Java, Spring Boot, Node.js, PostgreSQL, OpenAPI, IntelliJ, SQS, S3.
Full stack application development; writing, testing, and peer reviewing.
Built frontend and some yaml automation commands for proof of concept application that would build GitLab and GitHub workflows.
Reskinned frontend for application integration with a different company’s existing product.
JavaScript, React, Jest, Java, Spring Boot, Node.js, PostgreSQL, OpenAPI, IntelliJ, SQS, S3.

work.position: IT Infrastructure End User Support Technician I
highlights: Troubleshoot and research escalated IT issues.
Support IT Infrastructure operations and projects related to end users.
Troubleshooting on software and hardware issues via phone calls.
Wrote, formatted, and peer-reviewed internal documentation and end-user instructions.
Processed request tickets and created incident tickets using ServiceNow.
Created a mockup for a public-facing dashboard, of interactive maps indicating reliability and congestion of Oahu Roads and graphs of these trends over time
JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Charts.js, Leaflet.js, Bootstrap, ARC GIS, VSCode.
Reformat, update, and maintain databases.
Created an Excel macro to streamline metadata entry.
Upload documents, videos, and metadata.
Compiled research from academic papers into a decision matrix regarding locations of interest for future Mars water extraction missions.
Focus on Mars’ topography and weather.
Presented twice at HESTEMP, a NASA affiliated conference.
Design and update a website documenting the team’s fulfillment of grant requirements.
Media documentation of community outreach.
Mentored the group on budgeting and large scale planning.
Heartsaver First Aid CPR AED through The University of Hawai'is KRS 332 Emergency Response class
Activities Assistance: Art Class, “Penelope Project” Play, Bingo, Horse Racing, Spa Day
Commission sales on Hawaiian Jewelry, engravings, wood paddles, and Hawai'ian Weapons

Background.position: Blue Prints, College of Engineering at UHM
highlights: Developed a solution based on given parameters and budget to problem solve an open-ended scenario; to transport a package one-floor below without touching the lower floor.

Background.position: High School Internship Program, College of Engineering at UHM
highlights: Assisted in the engineering asphalt research lab at The University of Hawaii.
Engaged in skill-building workshops, and specialized lectures with guest speakers.
Presented research process and findings at culminating symposium.
Assisted in beta testing online certification courses.
